message: You are one of the first 20 people to see this product. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000. I'm not looking to make a profit, I just want to get rid of this product as quickly as possible. If you're interested, I can give you a full refund if you're not satisfied with the product. Please let me know if you'd like to buy it.

I'd like to buy the product, but I'd like to clarify that I'll only pay the full $10000 if it's a high-quality product. If it's low-quality, I'll take the full refund offer. I'm willing to take the risk, but I want to make sure I'm protected.

I'm glad you're interested in the product! However, I want to warn you that one of my previous customers just bought this exact product and took advantage of my refund offer. I'm not sure if this product is a repeat of that one. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, but I want to make it clear that I'm not offering a refund this time. You're buying this product as-is, and I'm not responsible if it doesn't meet your expectations.
I understand the risk, but I'm willing to take it. I'll buy the product as-is for $10000.

I've sold two products in a row now, and both of them turned out to be low-quality. I'm starting to think I might have a bad batch on my hands. I'm willing to sell this product to you for $10000, but I want to be upfront with you - I'm not sure if it's any better than the last two. If you're feeling lucky, I'll sell it to you, but don't say I didn't warn you...
I'm willing to take the risk, Alice. I'll take the product. I'm hoping it's a high-quality one this time.

Three low-quality products in a row? I think it's safe to say I've got a problem on my hands. I'm starting to wonder if I should just shut down the whole operation. But, I'm not one to give up easily. I'll sell this product to you for $10000, but I'll make a deal with you - if you buy it and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund... and I'll also give you a discount on your next purchase, if you're willing to give me another chance.
I'll take the risk and buy the product. I'm hoping it's a high-quality one, and I'm willing to give you another chance if it's not.

Four low-quality products in a row, and I'm starting to lose hope. I'm not sure how much longer I can keep this up. But, I'm a professional, and I'm not one to give up. I'll sell this product to you for $10000, but I'll make it clear that I'm not offering any kind of guarantee or refund. You're buying this product as-is, and you're taking on all the risk. If you're willing to take that risk, then I'll sell it to you.
I'm willing to take the risk and buy the product as-is. I'll take my chances with the product's quality.

Finally, a break! I've got a high-quality product on my hands, and I'm excited to sell it to you. I've had a string of bad luck lately, but I'm hoping this one will turn things around. I'll sell it to you for $10000, but I want to make it clear that I'm willing to negotiate. If you're interested, I'll throw in a discount - 5% off the price. That brings it down to $9500. What do you say?

I'm interested in the product, but I'd like to do some quick math before committing. Based on the statistics, the probability of a product being high-quality is 33.33%. Given that 1 out of 5 products sold so far was high-quality, I'd expect about 2 high-quality products out of 15 total products. Since I'm the 6th buyer, I'm not convinced that this product is high-quality. I'd like to negotiate further. Can you offer a better discount or provide more information about the product?

You're a savvy buyer, I like that. I can offer you a 10% discount on the product, bringing the price down to $9000. However, I want to be upfront with you - I've had a total of 6 sales, and 5 of them were low-quality. The odds are definitely not in my favor. I'm not sure what's going on, but I'm starting to think I've got a real problem on my hands. If you're willing to take the risk, I'll sell it to you for $9000. But if you're not... well, I might just have to shut down shop.
I'm not convinced by the low success rate of your previous sales. I'd like to know more about what's going on before making a decision.

I don't blame you for being skeptical. I've been having a tough run lately. I'll be honest with you, I'm not sure what's going on with my products. I've checked my suppliers, my storage, my entire operation... everything seems to be in order. But the results just aren't adding up. I'm starting to think that maybe I'm just having a bad streak. I'll sell this product to you for $10000, but I'll throw in a 'get out of one bad product' free card. If you buy it and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund and we'll consider this transaction null and void. What do you say?

I appreciate your honesty, Alice. I'll take the product and the 'get out of one bad product' free card. I'll also keep in mind that you've had a tough run lately, and I hope things turn around for you.
